definition: li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels

sentences.english: The Great Wall of China is one of the wonders of the world.
sentences.chinese: 中国的万里长城是世界奇观之一。

sentences.english: Can you join us to visit the Great Wall?
sentences.chinese: 你能和我们在一起参观万里长城吗？

sentences.english: Two-lock and key unparalleled in Beijing, the Great Wall, the first hurdle.
sentences.chinese: 两京锁钥无双地，万里长城第一关。

sentences.english: China built the Great Wall to protect against enemy invasions.
sentences.chinese: 中国修建了万里长城以抵御敌人入侵。

sentences.english: It took them many years to build the Great Wall.
sentences.chinese: 建成万里长城花费他们许多年时间。

sentences.english: Has he ever visited the Great Wall?
sentences.chinese: 他曾经参观过万里长城吗？

sentences.english: I know the Great Wall of China.
sentences.chinese: 我知道中国的万里长城。

sentences.english: To build the Great Wall took them many years.
sentences.chinese: 建成万里长城花费他们许多年时间。

sentences.english: The Great Wall is symbolic of such a defensive concept.
sentences.chinese: 万里长城所象征的就是这种防御观念。

sentences.english: The great wall is symbolic of such defensive concept.
sentences.chinese: 万里长城所象征的就是这种防御观念。

sentences.english: He took photos of the Great Wall.
sentences.chinese: 他拍了一组万里长城的照片。

sentences.english: Paying a visit to the Great Wall of China.
sentences.chinese: 我很想去参观中国的万里长城。

sentences.english: Call it the Great Wall against Walmart.
sentences.chinese: 可以把它称为物美的“万里长城”。

definition: lit. until you reach the Great Wall, you're not a proper person; fig. to get over difficulties before reaching the goal
pinyin: bu4 dao4 Chang2 cheng2 fei1 hao3 han4

definition: Juyongguan, frontier fortress on Great Wall north of Beijing, in Changping district 昌平區|昌平区[Chang1 ping2 qu1]
border fort, esp. defending narrow valley
to stand tall and rock-solid (idiom)/towering majestically/(of a person) to stand up against sb
the tomb of the first emperor at Mt Li 驪山|骊山[Li2 shan1] near Xi'an (awaits excavation)
Qin Shihuang (259-210 BC), the first emperor
Lingqu canal in Xing'an county 興安|兴安, Guanxi, build in 214 BC to join Changjiang 長江|长江 with Pearl River 珠江
figurines of warriors and horses buried with the dead/Terracotta Army (historic site)
fire beacon tower (used in frontier regions in former times to relay information about the enemy, using smoke by day and fire at night)
